reviews.review: Foodfight had a sequel, called the emoji movie (at least they did an effort to make a better animation but it steel bulshit)

Yeah, uh, never make something stupid like this again, Sony. You pushed Popeye and Medusa to the wayside for this trash?! I can't believe you! If your goal was to hurt your reputation as a studio, then congratulations! You did it! I hope you're proud of yourself. Oh, and by the way, Sony, I'm being sarcastic when I say I hope you're proud of yourself. I'm sure you probably know that, but then again, you were stupid enough to think that a movie about emojis was a good idea, so it wouldn't surprise me if you're stupid enough to not even know what the definition of sarcasm is. This isn't a movie. This is a tasteless and shameless hour and a half long commercial meant to advertise mobile apps trying to pass itself off as a "movie". It's just product placement overload. That's all it is. Skip this garbage and go see something else.

the movie was so great, my ship happens, there is such good character development and tHAT plot twist with jailbreak!1!1! GIRL I DID NOT SEE THAT COMING. the only reason I'm rating 4 starts is because I'm my opinion sir patrick stewart did not have enough screen time.
Truly something to enjoy, Great graphics, and fun story line
This is what our world has come to
Probably the most unnecessary film ever made.
It sucked the only thing I liked was ???

I really like t.j. miller but this was, well meh. I found it really hard to get into and its not for a lack of interest in animation I love it. I still watch cartoons till this day, more adult but cartoons none the less. My rating is based upon the fact that it was figured to be funny but I found it to be rather bland in that department. The writing was quite horrible the jokes were increasingly dry and moronic. It needed a lot more work is all I'm saying.

I saw the ratings then the movie, I thought it was descent, but something everyone needs to remember THIS IS A KIDS MOVIE. I went with my younger siblings and they enjoyed it, this movie wasn't made to entertain teenagers or adults, but kids.
Not sure why people hated it so much, I thought it was a cute contemporary movie.
